CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 14, 1945, pg. 5, reads: "Give Victory Tea - Members of the Hallie Q. Brown Chapter of the Harriet Tubman Guild gave a most successful Victory tea last Sunday afternoon at Kay Boys Club. Judge Lois McBride was the guest speaker.  Girl Scouts of Herron Hill Junior High helped serve.  Shown above are, left to right, standing: Mesdames Betty Champlin, Maggie Robinson, Thelma Snead, Eloise Armstrong, Rose Dukes, Catherine Hays, President Julia Stevenson, Ruth Butler, Helen Hunt, Florence Estridge, Johnny Mae Blakey, Catherine Palmer, Marie Charles, Anna May Blakey, and Betty Turner.  Seated are Mrs. Abraham Lincoln and Mrs. Geneva Allen. - Courier Photo by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Harriet Tubman Guild members, from left, standing: Betty Champlin, Maggie Robinson, Thelma Snead, Eloise Armstrong, Rose Dukes, Catherine Hays, Ruth Butler, Helen Hunt, Florence Estridge, Johnny Mae Blakey, Catherine Palmer, Marie Charles, Anna May Blakey, and Betty Turner; seated: Mrs. Abraham Lincoln and Geneva Allen, gathered with Herron Hill Junior High Girl Scouts for Victory tea in Kay Boys Club
